ml.alternet.parser.ast

Class NodeBuilder<Node>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.parser.handlers.TreeHandler<Node>
      • ml.alternet.parser.ast.NodeBuilder<Node>
  • Type Parameters:
    Node - The type of the target node.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Supplier<Node>, Rewindable, EventsHandler, Handler, DataHandler<Node>

    public class NodeBuilder<Node>
extends TreeHandler<Node>
    Builds an AST from a grammar, tokens mapper, and rules mapper.

    Usage :

    NodeBuilder nb = new NodeBuilder(grammar)
                             .setTokenMapper(tokenMapper)
                             .setRuleMapper(ruleMapper);
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeBuilder

        public NodeBuilder(Grammar grammar)
        Create a node builder. By default, the tokens mapper extract the value of the tokens and the rules mapper does nothing.
        Parameters:
        grammar - The grammar used during parsing.

      • tokenToNode

        public TreeHandler.Value<Node> tokenToNode(EventsHandler.TokenValue<?> token,
                                           Deque<TreeHandler.Value<Node>> next)
        Description copied from class: TreeHandler
        Transform a token value to a custom node of the target data structure.
        Specified by:
        tokenToNode in class TreeHandler<Node>
        Parameters:
        token - The actual token.
        next - The next values within the boundaries of the current rule. For example, if your grammar can parse "+ 123" and that "+" is the token, then "123" is the first item within the next values.
        Returns:
        A node

      • ruleToNode

        public TreeHandler.Value<Node> ruleToNode(Grammar.Rule rule,
                                          Deque<TreeHandler.Value<Node>> args)
        Description copied from class: TreeHandler
        Transform a rule and its arguments to a a custom node of the target data structure. The boundaries of the rule are defined by the rule start and rule end events, the events within are considered as argument (unless they are marked as fragments).
        Specified by:
        ruleToNode in class TreeHandler<Node>
        Parameters:
        rule - The actual rule
        args - The elements between rule start and rule end
        Returns:
        A node, or null to discard the rule and merge the args with the args of the nested rule.
        See Also:
        EventsHandler.RuleStart, EventsHandler.RuleEnd, Grammar.Fragment

      • build

        public Optional<Node> build(String input,
                            boolean matchAll)
                     throws IOException
        Entry point for building an expression.
        Parameters:
        input - An expression that follows the grammar, e.g. "sin(x)*(1+var_12)"
        matchAll - true to indicates that if the input contains more characters at the end of the parsing, an error will be reported, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        An evaluable expression.
        Throws:
        IOException - When an I/O error occurs.
